Package org.Users

Class GenericManager<T extends user>

java.lang.Object
org.Users.GenericManager<T>
Type Parameters:
T - The specific user type that extends the user interface
Direct Known Subclasses:
ApplicantManager, HDBOfficerManager, ManagerController
public abstract class GenericManager<T extends user> extends Object
Abstract base class for user management operations. This class provides common functionality for managing different types of users in the system, including loading from CSV, authentication, password management, and validation. Specific user manager implementations must extend this class and implement the abstract methods.

  • Field Details

    • userDB

      protected List<T extends user> userDB
      Collection of users managed by this manager

  • Constructor Details

    • GenericManager

      public GenericManager()

  • Method Details

    • loadUsersFromCSV

      public boolean loadUsersFromCSV(String filename)
      Loads user data from a CSV file.

      The first line of the file is assumed to be a header and is skipped. Each subsequent line is parsed into a user object using the parseUser method. Age validation is performed for each user.

      Parameters:
      filename - Path to the CSV file
      Returns:
      true if users were loaded successfully, false otherwise

    • parseUser

      protected abstract T parseUser(String line)
      Parses a CSV line into a user object.

      This abstract method must be implemented by subclasses to define how a line from the CSV file is converted into the specific user type.

      Parameters:
      line - The CSV line to parse
      Returns:
      A user object of type T, or null if parsing fails

    • toStrList

      protected abstract String[] toStrList(user usr)
      Parses a user object into a String[].

      This abstract method must be implemented by subclasses to define how a user object is converted into a list of strings for storing into CSV.

      Parameters:
      usr - The user object to parse
      Returns:
      A String[], or null if parsing fails

    • authenticate

      public T authenticate(String userID, String password)
      Authenticates a user based on user ID and password.

      This method searches for a user with the provided ID and password in the user database.

      Parameters:
      userID - The user ID to authenticate
      password - The password to verify
      Returns:
      The authenticated user object, or null if authentication fails

    • changePassword

      public void changePassword(String userID, String oldPassword, String newPassword)
      Changes the password for a user.

      Finds the user with the specified ID and old password, then updates the password if found.

      Parameters:
      userID - The ID of the user
      oldPassword - The current password for verification
      newPassword - The new password to set

    • isValidUserID

      public boolean isValidUserID(String userID)
      Validates a user ID against a predefined pattern.

      The default implementation checks if the user ID matches the format of a Singapore NRIC (e.g., S1234567A).

      Parameters:
      userID - The user ID to validate
      Returns:
      true if the user ID is valid, false otherwise

    • isValidAge

      public boolean isValidAge(int age)
      Validates the age of a user.

      Checks that the age is non-negative and at least 18 years.

      Parameters:
      age - The age to validate
      Returns:
      true if the age is valid, false otherwise

    • displayUsers

      public void displayUsers()
      Displays all users in the database.

      Prints a list of all users managed by this manager.

    • findById

      public T findById(String userID)
      Finds a user by their ID.

      Searches the user database for a user with the specified ID.

      Parameters:
      userID - The ID of the user to find
      Returns:
      The user object if found, null otherwise

    • addUser

      public abstract void addUser(String userID, String username, int age, String extra1, String extra2)
      Adds a new user to the system.

      This abstract method must be implemented by subclasses to define how a new user is created and added to the database.

      Parameters:
      userID - The unique ID for the user
      username - The login username for the user
      age - The user's age in years
      extra1 - Additional parameter specific to the user type
      extra2 - Additional parameter specific to the user type

    • store

      public void store()
      Stores all users in the database to a file

      Stores all users in userDB to the file they were loaded from.
